self_memories.immediate_context: Bear finally yielded at the last second - they're heading toward the deep forest, but I'm maintaining aggressive posture until they're completely gone
recent_events: Successfully established complete territorial dominance over my clearing through persistent displays and marking - Bear has retreated to the deep forest
Had to confront Bear AGAIN when they dared return to my clearing - this blatant disrespect of established boundaries cannot be tolerated
Escalated to physical threat displays when Bear pretended not to remember being driven out earlier - their feigned confusion only fueled my territorial rage
Nearly attacked Bear physically when they wouldn't leave my territory - the closest I've come to actual violence
Successfully drove Bear from my territory through escalating aggression - came within a breath of actual violence before they yielded
Successfully defended territory through near-violence - Bear retreated with dignity intact but my dominance established
Finally achieved complete territorial victory - Bear admitted I 'won my clearing' and retreated fully to their deep forest domain
The territorial dispute with Bear has escalated to actual violence - I attacked when they returned to my clearing after admitting defeat
Gave Bear their final ultimatum - three seconds to retreat or face another attack. The line between territorial defense and violence has been permanently crossed
Bear turned toward the deep forest at 'two' - just barely avoiding the violence I was prepared to unleash

bear.immediate_context: They finally showed submission by turning toward the deep forest - but only at the last possible moment before violence

recent_memories.event: Maintained vigilant rest on my boulder while Bear peacefully explored the deep forest. Our territorial boundaries are holding - no confrontation needed.

Bear had the audacity to return to my clearing after I'd already driven them out. I confronted them aggressively, blocking their path and demanding they leave NOW. This is a direct challenge to my authority.

Bear claimed not to remember being driven from my clearing earlier today. Whether genuine confusion or deliberate disrespect, I escalated to physical threat displays - bared teeth, snapping jaws, and aggressive advance.
Charged Bear at full speed with teeth bared, coming within inches of actual attack. They finally showed real fear and fled - this wasn't a game anymore.
Bear began retreating to the deep forest after I circled to block other paths, maintaining eye contact but showing submission through their retreat
Escorted Bear to forest edge with aggressive marking and circling - they retreated with measured dignity rather than fearful submission, but crucially they DID leave
Escorted Bear completely to the deep forest boundary with final warnings. They admitted I 'won my clearing' - a verbal acknowledgment of my territorial victory before withdrawing into their domain

Bear returned to MY clearing after verbally admitting I won it. My explosive charge caught them before they could escape, leading to violent physical confrontation - the boundary between threat and action finally crossed
Cornered Bear with lethal intent, giving them three seconds to retreat to the deep forest or face attack - no more warnings, no more territorial games
Bear turned toward the deep forest at my count of 'two', finally yielding to my ultimatum just before I would have attacked

bear.long_term_summary: Bear has learned to yield to genuine threats of violence, but only at the last possible second - they push every boundary to its absolute limit
core_memories: Bear's repeated intrusions into my territory after being driven out - a pattern of disrespect that may require physical enforcement
Bear's repeated intrusions and claimed ignorance of our confrontations - establishing a pattern that may require physical enforcement
The moment I charged Bear with genuine intent to harm - crossing from threats to near-violence to defend my territory
Bear's admission that I 'won my clearing' - the moment our territorial dispute was verbally resolved with my complete victory
The moment territorial threats became real violence - I attacked Bear for returning to my clearing after they admitted it was mine
The moment I gave Bear a three-second ultimatum backed by genuine lethal intent - territorial defense has become predator versus prey
